DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Portal Vein Excision Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether an operative procedure involving removal or resection of the portal vein (a short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver) was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Portal Vein Excision Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the operative procedure involving removal or resection of the portal vein (a short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver) having been performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.:Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a portal vein embolization (PVE) or other hepatic preconditioning techniques already performed or are preconditioning techniques such as PVE planned for this patient?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Resection of the superior mesenteric vein or portal vein
